definition: to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Long-term breeding dogs in outdoor feeding incidence was significantly higher than indoor dogs.
sentences.chinese: 長期豢養在室外的犬發病率明顯高於室內豢養犬。

sentences.english: Long-term breeding dogs in outdoor feeding incidence was significantly higher than indoor dogs.
sentences.chinese: 長期豢養在室外的犬發病率明顯高於室內豢養犬。

sentences.english: Years ago, zoos kept all kinds of animals in small cages.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前，動物園在小籠子裏豢養各種各樣的動物。

sentences.english: Is keeping wild animals where people can see them a good idea?
sentences.chinese: 豢養野生動物供人們觀賞，這主意究竟好不好？

sentences.english: Kamba people raise elephants for farming.
sentences.chinese: 坎巴人爲了農耕而豢養大象。

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
